thing-type.label: ZW099 Smart Dimmer 6
thing-type.description: Smart Dimmer 6<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtAeotec Smart Dimmer 6 is a low-cost Z-Wave Dimmer plug-in module specifically used to enable Z-Wave command and control (on/off/dim) of any incandescent bulbs, dimmable LED bulbs, halogen bulbs with or without transformers. It can report immediate wattage consumption or kWh energy usage over a period of time. In the event of power failure, non-volatile memory retains all programmed information relating to the unit’s operating status.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<ol&gt<li&gtInsert the Smart Dimmer to power socket, The RGB LED will be colorful gradient status.</li&gt <li&gtLet the primary controller into inclusion mode (If you don’t know how to do this, refer to its manual).</li&gt <li&gtPress the Action button.</li&gt <li&gtIf the inclusion success, Smart Dimmer LED will be solid. Otherwise, the LED will remain colorful gradient status, in which you need to repeat the process from step 2.</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<ol&gt<li&gtInsert the Smart Dimmer to power socket, The Smart Dimmer LED will be solid.</li&gt <li&gtLet the primary controller into remove mode (If you don’t know how to do this, refer to its manual).</li&gt <li&gtPress the Action button.</li&gt <li&gtIf the remove is successful, Smart Dimmer LED will be colorful gradient status. If Smart Dimmer LED still be solid, please repeat the process from step 2.</li&gt </ol&gt

parameter.name: config_3_1
parameter.label: 3: Current Overload Protection
parameter.description: Toggle current overload protection<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtOutput Load will be turned off automatically when the Current overrun 2.6A and the time more than 2 minutes (0=disabled, 1=enabled). </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_20_1
parameter.label: 20: Initial Load State
parameter.description: Configure the iniital output load state after re-power on<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtConfigure the output load status after re-power on (0=last status, 1=always on, 2=always off) </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_33_4
parameter.label: 33: RGB LED Color Test
parameter.description: Set the RGB LED color value for testing<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSet the RGB LED color value for testing (64-bit value).</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtValue1: Red value (0-255) (16-bits: 48-63)</li&gt <li&gtValue2: Green value (0-255) (16-bits: 32-47)</li&gt <li&gtValue3: Blue value (0-255) (16-bits: 16-31)</li&gt <li&gtValue4: Reserved (0-255) (16-bits: 0-15)</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gtExample Values:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtRed = -16777216 (0xFF000000)</li&gt <li&gtGreen = 16711680 (0x00FF0000)</li&gt <li&gtBlue = 65280 (0x0000FF00)</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gt<strong&gtNOTE:<br /&gt</strong&gtIn OpenHAB and HABmin (or other Java software) To enter an unsigned integer value greater than 2147483647 you must convert the value to a signed 32-bit value. </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_80_1
parameter.label: 80: Notification on Status Change
parameter.description: Enable notifications for Group 1 device associations.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtEnable to send notifications to associated devices (Group 1) when the state of Smart Dimmer’s load changed (0=nothing, 1=hail CC, 2=basic CC report). </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_81_1
parameter.label: 81: LED Indicator Mode
parameter.description: Configure the LED mode.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtConfigure the state of LED when it is in 3 modes below:<br /&gt</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gt0= Energy mode, the LED will follow the status (on/off) of its load.</li&gt <li&gt1= Momentary indicate mode, when the state of Dimmer’s load changed, The LED will follow the status (on/off) of its load, but the red LED will turn off after 5 seconds if there is no any switch action.</li&gt <li&gt2= Night light mode. </li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_83_3
parameter.label: 83: LED Color for Night Light
parameter.description: Configure the RGB value when it is in Night light mode<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtConfigure the RGB value when it is in Night light mode. (48-bit value)</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtValue1: Red color value (0-255) (16-bits: 32-47)</li&gt <li&gtValue2: Green color value (0-255) (16-bits: 16-31)</li&gt <li&gtValue3: Blue color value (0-255) (16-bits: 0-15)</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gtExample Values:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtBlue = 255 (0x0000FF)</li&gt <li&gtGreen = 65280 (0x00FF00)</li&gt <li&gtRed = 16711680 (0xFF0000)</li&gt <li&gtWhite = 1774619 (0xFFFFFF)</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_84_3
parameter.label: 84: LED Brightness
parameter.description: Brightness level of RGB LED (0%-100%)<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtConfigure the brightness level of RGB LED (0%-100%) when it is in Energy Mode/momentary indicate mode. (48-bit value)</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtValue1: green brightness value. (0-100) (16-bits: 32-47)</li&gt <li&gtValue2: yellow brightness value. (0-100) (16-bits: 16-31)</li&gt <li&gtValue3: red brightness value. (0-100) (16-bits: 0-15)</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gtDefault value is 50% brightness on all colors: 3289650 (0x323232)</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtGreen=50 (0x320000)</li&gt <li&gtYellow=50 (0x003200)</li&gt <li&gtRed=50 (0x000032)</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gtMaximum value is 100% brightness on all colors: 6579300 (0x646464)</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtGreen=100 (0x640000)</li&gt <li&gtYellow=100 (0x006400)</li&gt <li&gtRed=100 (0x000064)</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.description: Enables/disables parameter 91 and 92 (reporting minimum wattage)<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtEnables/disables parameter 91 (minimum change in wattage value) and 92 (minimum change in wattage percent).</p&gt <p&gtSupported values: 1=enabled, 0=disabled</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_92_1
